Instrument.name: ALICE ULTRAVIOLET IMAGING SPECTROGRAPH
Instrument.description: The Alice instrument is an ultraviolet mapping spectrometer designed to study the atmosphere of Pluto. The scientific objectives are to determine the mole fractions of N2, CH4, CO, and Ar to 1% in total mixing ratio in the atmosphere, to profile the temperature structure of the upper atmosphere, and to acheive H lyman-alpha mapping of the Pluto-Charon system to study the rate of Roche-lobe flow from Pluto to Charon. it will also be used to search for atmospheres around Charon and any Kuiper belt Objects encountered. Alice has two modes of operation, an airglow mode which measures emissions from from the atmosphere and an occultation mode which is used when the Sun or a bright star can be viewed through the atmosphere.
